review: I love the chromecast. Simple. Inexpensive. Yet high quality.I use my android tablet as the "remote". If you have videos on your computer, I recommend Chromecast and the Plex app. In no time I was streaming my media library to the Chromecast.  The Plex app costs a few dollars.  I think it is worth it.
author: Ari Zelanko

review: There is a bug in the ChromeCast code that causes massive interference with local WiFi networks under certain circumstances.I have three ChromeCast and had problems with one of the others previously, but had thought that recent updates had taken care of the problem, having not seen the issue recently.This one, however, being installed in a different location exhibits the exact same problem that I had earlier.If you do a brief web search, you will find additional information (but no answers) about the problem.
author: Alan Clegg

review: I bought this so that I no longer needed a long hdmi cable to stream internet content from my laptop to my HDTV.  I am extremely pleased with the unit. I also have an original Roku and a Roku 3 - this won't replace a Roku unit - it isn't meant to , but it will provide you with an easy way to watch internet content on your HDTV.  I found the device to be easy to set up and easy to use. All you need is an HDMI port.  This is an excellent value and a lot of bang for the buck.
